Sure feels like 10 years!


Showtime always started each season at the end of June, played 12 episodes, re-ran them for the next 12 weeks, and would start the final 12 around January.

HOWEVER, in a weird and stupid way, 9/11 screwed this up. Showtime bought this new series, Jeremiah (based on an European comic and created by J. Michael Straczynski of Babylon 5). BUT the chickens**t powers that be at Showtime got all squirlley, thinking people wouldn't want to watch a post-apocalyptic series like Jeremiah because of 9/11, so they delayed it's premeire by 3 months and, because they wanted to run Stargate and Jeremiah as a package, that ended up delaying Stargate.

Bloody effing terrorists. It's all their fault.

But now it's 36 hours -- oops, 35 hours & 35 minutes until "Proving Ground".
